title: Aaron's 2006 Baja
subtitle: The Ultimate Drag and Drive Car

sections.heading: Project Overview
sections.text: This 2006 Subaru Baja was purpose-built with one goal in mind: competing in Drag and Drive events. The Baja platform is a rare and unconventional starting point, yet it offers a practical truck bed ideal for hauling tools and spare parts during the long road segments. Retaining the rear seats was a deliberate choice, allowing space for additional pit crew members—meaning more help when it counts and more fun along the way.

sections.heading: Performance Upgrades
sections.text: The engine is built around a 2.35L destroked short block, sleeved and secured with 1/2-inch head studs, and fitted with GSC 282 camshafts. This setup is capable of handling over 40 psi of boost from an S366 turbocharger, supplemented by a 100-horsepower shot of nitrous, producing approximately 800 horsepower on a Mustang dyno. Airflow is managed through a shaved 2.5 intake manifold and an air-to-water intercooler with an ice box, keeping intake temperatures under control for hard quarter-mile passes. For improved access and faster servicing, the radiator was relocated to the truck bed.

sections.heading: Drivetrain Features
sections.text: All of that power is sent to the pavement through a bone-stock STI six-speed transmission. While a few output shafts have met their limits, the rest of the drivetrain has proven virtually bulletproof, featuring a custom 3-inch steel driveshaft, 1,000-horsepower-rated DSS rear axles, and hubs machined from aerospace-grade materials. The factory R180 rear differential continues to hold strong, with shock loads ultimately transferred to the ground through Hoosier DR2 drag radial tires.

sections.heading: Build Philosophy
sections.text: This 2007 STI was built with one clear objective: to dominate every car show it attends. Producing over 500 AWHP, it’s far from just a visual statement. A Garrett turbocharger forces air through a custom V-mount intercooler and into the engine via a Process West intake manifold, delivering both power and reliability. The aggressive widebody paired with its latest wrap gives the car a fighter-jet–inspired presence, looking absolutely unreal when fully aired out and slammed to the ground.

sections.heading: Engine & Drivetrain
sections.text: At the core of this STI is a fully built, in-house EJ257, featuring upgraded pistons and rods secured with ARP hardware. Power is delivered by a GTX3582R turbocharger, pushing impressive numbers through the stock 6-speed transmission while maintaining long-term reliability. This setup strikes the perfect balance between performance and durability.

sections.heading: Interior
sections.text: This STI impresses just as much inside as it does outside. A Cusco roll cage anchors a fully custom interior, from bespoke carpeting to a one-off trunk setup. The interior houses the air ride and sound systems, all brought together with tasteful interior lighting that highlights the craftsmanship throughout.

sections.heading: The Perfect Balance
sections.text: Richard's 2006 STI strikes the perfect balance between show-quality aesthetics and real-world performance. This build proves you don't have to sacrifice looks for speed.

sections.heading: Aesthetic Excellence
sections.text: From the custom paint to the meticulously detailed engine bay, every aspect of this STI has been refined. Premium wheels, aggressive fitment, and tasteful exterior mods create a cohesive and stunning package.

sections.heading: Performance Meets Style
sections.text: Beneath the beautiful exterior lies serious performance upgrades including engine management, exhaust, and suspension work that allows this STI to perform as good as it looks.

sections.heading: Built to Slide
sections.text: This 2004 Impreza has been transformed into a dedicated drift weapon. Every component has been chosen and installed with sideways action in mind, creating a car that's as fun to drive as it is to watch. All this, without breaking the bank.

sections.heading: Drift Setup
sections.text: Featuring a welded center and rear differential, custom angle kit, and hydraulic handbrake, this Impreza is equipped with all the essentials for serious drift work. The suspension is dialed in for maximum angle and control.

sections.heading: Power Delivery
sections.text: The engine has been tuned for responsive power delivery that's perfect for initiating and holding drifts. This is achieved by using a Version 8 JDM engine swap with a factory VF37 twin scroll turbo kit. E85 fuel and upgraded cooling ensures consistent performance during extended sessions.

sections.heading: Ultimate Street Car
sections.text: The goal of this build was to create the ultimate street car—one that prioritizes daily drivability without sacrificing performance. The engine bay features a stock-location Forced Performance Blue turbo plumbed with custom pie-cut stainless steel intercooler piping, blending form and function seamlessly. Factory air conditioning and all creature comforts are retained, proving that high performance doesn’t have to come at the cost of convenience.

sections.heading: Under the Cover
sections.text: At first glance, the car appears relatively stock, aside from some refined piping and bolt-on upgrades. Beneath the surface, however, lies a full suite of motorsports-grade equipment. A Nitrous Express system is fully integrated and controlled through a Link standalone ECU, with operation managed via the Link CAN keypad. Arming, purging, boost adjustments, and on-the-fly launch RPM changes are all handled effortlessly from the keypad and Razor PDM, putting total control at the driver’s fingertips.

sections.heading: Daily Driven Performance
sections.text: Despite its serious modifications, this STI remains a true daily driver. Comfort and usability have been carefully preserved, proving that performance and practicality can coexist. One-of-one custom wheels provide flawless fitment on the stock body, allowing for a low ride height without any rubbing, while Fortune Auto coilovers deliver a smooth, controlled ride. Meticulous attention to detail ensures this car feels just as at home on the street as it does on the showroom floor.

sections.heading: Widebody Transformation
sections.text: Rene's 2019 STI features an aggressive widebody kit that transforms the car's presence on the road. This isn't just about looks - the wider stance allows for larger wheels and tires, improving both grip and aesthetics.

sections.heading: Head-Turning Design
sections.text: Every angle of this STI commands attention. The widebody kit is complemented by custom aero, unique lighting, and a show-quality paint finish that makes this one of the most recognizable STIs on the street.

sections.heading: Performance to Match
sections.text: The performance upgrades match the aggressive exterior. Engine modifications, upgraded turbocharger, and supporting mods ensure this STI has the power to back up its bold looks.

sections.heading: State of the Art
sections.text: This 2020 STI represents the pinnacle of modern Subaru performance. Starting with the latest platform, this build incorporates cutting-edge modifications and technology.

sections.heading: Technology Integration
sections.text: Modern engine management, data logging, and tuning capabilities allow this STI to extract maximum performance while maintaining reliability and drivability.

sections.heading: Complete Package
sections.text: From suspension to brakes, exhaust to intake, every system has been thoughtfully upgraded to create a cohesive and impressive performance package.
